86b17bb2-c272-4f69-8fb8-33c6adbed00e.description: Our discovery tool is an empowering first step for staff and students to reflect on their digital capabilities and to identify current strengths and areas for development. The discovery tool is a developmental tool that students and staff can use to self-assess their digital capabilities, identify their strengths and opportunities to develop their skills further to enhance their practice of learning.
86b17bb2-c272-4f69-8fb8-33c6adbed00e.name: Jisc discovery tool - Overall Digital Capabilities

badge_template_activities.title: This digital badge is evidence that the participant has completed all 15 sections of the Jisc discovery tool ‘Explore your overall digital capabilities’ question set and viewed their report.

badge_template_activities.title: This digital badge is evidence that the participant has completed all 8 sections of the Jisc discovery tool ‘Teaching in further education and skills’ question set and viewed their report.

771a277b-2bb7-4149-92af-c62e1d4b2f69.description: Digital leaders programme explores and challenges the role of leadership across a broad range of digital-related issues and the way they influence organisational strategy and individual practice. Aimed at current and aspiring leaders and managers from higher and further education organisations, the programme forms part of our wider approach to building digital capability in the sectors we support.
771a277b-2bb7-4149-92af-c62e1d4b2f69.name: Digital leaders programme

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the Digital Leaders Programme (online or in-person format). This entails taking part in all modules and engaging in activities and discussions throughout the programme. Participants are also required to develop an online journal to demonstrate key learning from the course.
The earner of this badge has fully completed the Jisc Digital Leaders Programme

Module 1 Mapping Digital Exploring the definitions and focus of a digital leader, digital practice, digital presence, and identity. Mapping use of digital within organisations. • What does your organisation look like now? • Framing Digital Leadership • Mapping your Digital Practice • Leadership and Digital Presence • Digital Perceptions

Module 2 Digital Transformation Exploring the future of digital practices, institutional values, themes, and challenges, identifying common pitfalls and misconceptions. Approaches for organisational change. • What will your organisation look like in the future? • Digital Odyssey • Digital Lens • Co-Design • Anchoring Change

Module 3 Understanding your organisation Using data, narrative thinking, and digital storytelling to build a rich picture of your institution. Action mapping effective actions as a digital leader. • Understanding your organisation • Delivering strategy by building capacity • Design thinking • Sceptics and Enthusiasts

Module 4 Pulling it all together Managing digital innovation and platforms and vision for change. Review and planning for digital leadership roadmap. • Mainstreaming Innovation • Vision for change • Joining the dots • Roadmap to change The participant has demonstrated that they have met all module criteria and course outcomes through • Fully participating in all session activities, interactions, and peer discussion • Completion of the online course journal

c67e7bb5-4b8c-46cd-bba6-3fcfe6e8288c.description: Cyber Essentials helps give peace of mind that you’ve put essential security protections in place – and is critical for both reputation and compliance. Jisc offers Cyber Essentials as a service. This course is led by a Cyber Essentials assessor and designed to guide you through the 79 questions and prepare your organisation for certification. It explores the 79 questions involved in the Cyber Essentials certification process, what they mean to your institution and the common problems and issues.
c67e7bb5-4b8c-46cd-bba6-3fcfe6e8288c.name: Cyber Essentials - prepare for certification

badge_template_activities.title: This course consists of one x3 hour live online session. Being awarded this digital credential is dependent on the participant fulfilling all the Jisc training course criteria. In doing so this participant has shown they are able to:
Highlight the benefits of obtaining Cyber Essentials certification​ to your organisation
Apply the 79 questions to your own organisation
Identify potential challenges and have a plan to resolve those​
Have a road map to Cyber Essentials certification​ planned
Have succesfully completed the test questions
Have confidence in applying for Cyber Essentials certification​
This participant has demonstrated they have met these outcomes by:
Taking part in all activities
Being fully engaged in interactions
Contributing to discussions

c2b3141d-025c-4eee-8298-7d2988fcd9dd.description: Analytics Labs for HE provides a unique continuing professional development (CPD) experience for data-savvy staff working in education. Analytics Labs see cross-institutional teams of business intelligence analysts working together to address pressing sector issues.
c2b3141d-025c-4eee-8298-7d2988fcd9dd.name: Analytics Labs for HE

badge_template_activities.title: Teams use agile project methodologies and cutting-edge tools such as Tableau and Alteryx to create insightful data visualisations from a combination of data sources. These proofs-of-concept are reviewed by peers and a panel of experts and, where appropriate, developed for wider sector access to inform strategic decision-making.
This participant has attended for the entire 3 months and demonstrated the following five competencies:
Participating in Agile Development
Visualising Data
Transforming Data
Digital Collaboration
Understanding Policy and the Data Landscape

6541726c-42a6-43cd-856f-a7fc94e368f6.description: Our discovery tool is an empowering first step for staff and students to reflect on their digital capabilities and to identify current strengths and areas for development. The discovery tool is a developmental tool that students and staff can use to self-assess their digital capabilities, identify their strengths and opportunities to develop their skills further to enhance their practice of learning.
6541726c-42a6-43cd-856f-a7fc94e368f6.name: Jisc discovery tool - Library & Learning Resources

badge_template_activities.title: This digital badge is evidence that the participant has completed all 7 sections of the Jisc discovery tool ‘Working in a library or learning resources?’ question set and viewed their report.

badge_template_activities.title: This digital badge is evidence that the participant has completed all 8 sections of the Jisc discovery tool ‘Teaching in HE’ question set and viewed their report.

4150ff99-be97-4567-8f3f-19ab5378086f.description: Cyber Essentials helps give peace of mind that you’ve put essential security protections in place – and is critical for both reputation and compliance. Jisc offers Cyber Essentials as a service. This course is led by a Cyber Essentials assessor and designed to guide you through the 79 questions and prepare your organisation for certification. It explores the 79 questions involved in the Cyber Essentials certification process, what they mean to your institution and the common problems and issues.
4150ff99-be97-4567-8f3f-19ab5378086f.name: Cyber Essentials - prepare for certification

badge_template_activities.title: This course consists of one x3 hour live online session. The learner has been awarded the completed digital badge for taking part in all activities, being fully engaged in interactions, contributing to discussions. And further to this fulfilled the following criteria for this Jisc training course demonstrated digital badge;
This learner has read, completed and submitted all the course activities and assessment to an acceptable standard. Including the following;
Reviewed all 79 questions which are asked during a Cyber Essentials assessment. Once reviewed has selected the 5 most challenging questions and explained why.
OR watched the 'What is Cyber Essentials?' video and successfully answered the subsequent questions in the short quiz.
AND completed the Cyber Essentials course assessment. Gained pass mark of 75% or more and done so no later than 2 weeks post course completion.

3a3612e4-568b-4f76-befd-3ebac41eb88b.description: Developing learners' employability skills is a key driver for organisations who want to prepare their learners for the 21st century workplace.
3a3612e4-568b-4f76-befd-3ebac41eb88b.name: Developing learners' employability skills

badge_template_activities.title: This workshop explores ways in which technology enhanced learning can support the development of key employability skills for learners. Course outcomes are that this participant has:
Explored the Jisc model of employability skills.
Identify barriers to employability.
Understood how technology enhanced learning can support and develop these skills.
Share examples of technology based activities which can be done in the classroom or at a distance.
This participant has demonstrated they have met these outcomes by:
Taking part in all activities.
Being fully engaged in interactions.
Contributing to discussions.

15f309da-1733-4aca-9529-f345cd382060.description: Penetration testing is the practice of testing a computer system, network or web application to find security vulnerabilities that an attacker could exploit. This training course is aimed at the security community, IT staff and IT managers from Jisc member institutions. The course consists of a full day hands-on workshop.
15f309da-1733-4aca-9529-f345cd382060.name: Pen testing - think like a hacker

badge_template_activities.title: This course consists of 1 day F2F (face to face). Being awarded this digital credential is dependent on the participant fulfilling all the Jisc training course criteria. In doing so this participant has shown they are able to:
Understand how an attacker can use available resources and tools to investigate a target
Identify vulnerabilities on their own network
Understand how to fix issues and be aware of resources to make this an iterative process
Develop a working understanding of “hacker” tools for network scanning and exploitation
This participant has demonstrated they have met these outcomes by:
Taking part in all activities
Being fully engaged in interactions
Contributing to discussions
Completing all assignments

6bdf8472-e9e3-4482-acc1-6906bd306527.description: Supporting learners’ digital identity and wellbeing is a 2 hour live online workshop which equips participants with an understanding of the issues learners face when developing digital identities. The workshop helps build confidence in participants and provide them with a range of activities to use with learners so they can make informed and responsible choices when using digital technologies that help them thrive in a digital world.
6bdf8472-e9e3-4482-acc1-6906bd306527.name: Supporting learners’ digital identity and wellbeing

badge_template_activities.title: The course consists of one participative live online session. It provides an opportunity for organisations to identify and share best practices in how to support learners' digital identity and wellbeing.
Being awarded this digital credential is dependent on the participant fulfilling all the Jisc training course criteria. In doing so this participant has shown they are able to:
Discuss the key drivers for supporting learners’ with their digital identity and wellbeing
Design and adapt curriculum activities to support students’ digital capabilities
Identify what we can do as individuals (and as institutions) to ensure the digital wellbeing of learners
Participants will demonstrate they have met these outcomes by;
Having taken part in all activities
Fully engaged in interaction
Contributed to discussions
Completed all assignments

f1d341a4-d006-449f-bb09-c3142f14ad48.description: Cyber Essentials Plus is the next step after achieving Cyber Essentials certification. This course is led by a Cyber Essentials Plus assessor and designed to guide you through the verification process of the controls needed to pass Cyber Essentials for your organisation. Suitable for a wide audience from security roles and IT roles, including desktop, sys-admins and network teams.
f1d341a4-d006-449f-bb09-c3142f14ad48.name: Cyber Essentials Plus - preparing for verification

badge_template_activities.title: This course consists of one x2 hour live online session. Being awarded this digital credential is dependent on the participant fulfilling all the Jisc training course criteria. In doing so this participant has shown they are able to:
Understand  fundamentals and benefits of obtaining Cyber Essentials Plus certification​
Know the tools used and how the assessment is carried out
Know where potential challenges lie and know options to resolve those​ in advance
Have confidence in applying for Cyber Essentials Plus certification
Know how to get more help if you need it​
This participant has demonstrated they have met these outcomes by:
Taking part in all activities
Being fully engaged in interactions
Contributing to discussions

17837954-f31f-4c26-8662-514370e8430c.description: Designing for digital capabilities in the curriculum is a 2 session live online workshop. It will build confidence to design and deliver a digital curriculum that will prepare students to learn successfully in digital settings, and to thrive in a digital world. It will also include a series of activities which will support participants with designing in opportunities for students to develop relevant digital capabilities into their course, module or unit of learning.
17837954-f31f-4c26-8662-514370e8430c.name: Designing for digital capabilities in the curriculum

badge_template_activities.title: Course outcomes are that this participant will:
Discuss how the curriculum is changing and needs to change in response to digital developments.
Design curriculum activities to support participants’ digital capabilities.
Assess their own digital capabilities and development needs as a teacher.
Plan to use the activities and resources in their own setting
This participant has demonstrated they have met these outcomes by:
Taking part in all activities.
Being fully engaged in interactions.
Contributing to discussions.

a8be7293-1b6a-440d-9219-b805d9cdfffd.description: This course has been designed to provide you with an introduction to Heidi Plus and is suitable for anyone planning on using the tool with little to no knowledge of HESA data and/or an analytical background.
a8be7293-1b6a-440d-9219-b805d9cdfffd.name: Heidi Plus Essentials

badge_template_activities.title: Heidi Plus Essentials is a fully interactive course that requires participants to engage in practical activities using Heidi Plus and HESA data. On completion of this course the participant will be able to:
Navigate Heidi Plus and access the appropriate HESA data sources
Create and format data visualisation workbooks using various HESA data sources (Student, Staff, Finance, Estates, Student Leaver)
Create common data visualisations using various HESA data sources (Student, Staff, Finance, Estates, Student Leaver)
Explore and use HESA Dashboards
Apply Data Protection Principles when using Heidi Plus
Export and share their workbooks
Participants will demonstrate they have met these outcomes by:
Participated in each of the interactive activities
Completed homework tasks
Attended the full training session(s)

1de42ebd-8f49-44d3-b036-3621b6700a8b.description: The ability to write and repurpose content for the web is an important skill. Visitors can abandon your site at the click of a button if they are not engaged by what you have written. From September 2018, legislation now means digital inclusion is a right for users rather than a privilege. People writing content for organisational websites need to understand the impact of clear communication on accessibility.
1de42ebd-8f49-44d3-b036-3621b6700a8b.name: Writing for the digital world

badge_template_activities.title: This Writing for the digital world course consists of a 2x 2 participative live online sessions with tasks to be completed between each session. Course outcomes are that this participant has:
Practised techniques for writing and repurposing content for web delivery
Explored key practical issues surrounding the provision of web content
Critically evaluated a range of real and potential web content
Identified the key points to successful web writing
Participants will demonstrate they have met these outcomes by;
Attended both sessions
Fully participated in all the live activities
Interacted throughout

64d63dbd-23c0-4e49-ba56-88a6dd5780c2.description: Digital leaders programme explores and challenges the role of leadership across a broad range of digital-related issues and the way they influence organisational strategy and individual practice. Aimed at current and aspiring leaders and managers from higher and further education organisations, the programme forms part of our wider approach to building digital capability in the sectors we support.
64d63dbd-23c0-4e49-ba56-88a6dd5780c2.name: Digital leaders programme

badge_template_activities.title: Digital leaders programme

This is an optional intermediate badge that participants can apply for upon submission of a reflective piece of work, building on the participants programme journal to highlight how completing the DLP has or might impact on personal practice.

This digital badge is evidence that the participant has completed the Jisc Digital Leaders Programme. They will then have been awarded the Jisc training course completed digital badge and further to this fulfilled the following criteria for this Jisc training course demonstrated digital badge;

Submitted an optional reflective outline of their experience of undertaking the course, identifying how it has, or will impact on their personal practice. Full information for which is detailed below:
Submissions are welcomed in flexible format including audio, video, or text format up to a maximum of 5mins or 500 words. Participants are encouraged to incorporate diagrams or images as appropriate.

33143502-1c0c-4cb1-b8f0-467d83ccac46.description: This is the second course in a series of four on the theme of making assistive technology decisions. The course is suitable for those seeking an introduction to assistive technology for deaf or hard of hearing students in further and higher education, there are opportunities for more experienced practitioners to reflect on or enhance their existing practice.
33143502-1c0c-4cb1-b8f0-467d83ccac46.name: Making assistive technology decisions: assistive technology for students who are deaf or hard of hearing

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of this Jisc training course entails taking part and being fully engaged throughout the live online session. This participant has demonstrated they have met these outcomes by: • Taking part in all activities • Being fully engaged in interactions • Contributing to discussions

skills.name: Accessibility And Inclusiveness In Course Design

bb60f8ae-3b37-4160-b45d-61bf95695cd5.description: This course offers practical advice for developing a fresh approach to information security awareness and training, a key component of a strong security culture. It's intended for staff who are responsible for or contribute to information security communications, education, awareness and training activities. This includes staff responsible for developing and delivering organisational training and communications activities, as well as IT and security teams.
bb60f8ae-3b37-4160-b45d-61bf95695cd5.name: Developing effective security awareness campaigns

badge_template_activities.title: This course consists of one x1.5 hour live online session. Being awarded this digital credential is dependent on the participant fulfilling all the Jisc training course criteria. In doing so this participant has shown they are able to:
Implement a strategic approach to information security training and awareness activity, including ways to measure its impact and effectiveness
Develop a range of timely, accessible communications and training activities across the information security curriculum
Recognise common information security misunderstandings and misconceptions, and how to address them
This participant has demonstrated they have met these outcomes by:
Taking part in all activities
Being fully engaged in interactions
Contributing to discussions

e6ce8146-77f5-4af6-b2d3-3750112612ad.description: Modern students face a plethora of stressful and emotionally difficult situations. Their digital lifestyles mean that these situations can occur 24 hours a day, seven days a week and it is often frontline staff who are the first on the scene. The course includes scenarios that relate to difficult emotions, common mental health difficulties and addressing challenging behaviour.
e6ce8146-77f5-4af6-b2d3-3750112612ad.name: Managing Emotionally Challenging Situations for Frontline Staff

badge_template_activities.title: This Managing Emotionally Challenging Situations for Frontline Staff course consists of of a 2x 2 hour live online sessions. This course runs through a series of scenarios allowing delegates to practice and develop their skills in managing emotionally challenging conversations. It provides an opportunity for organisations to identify and share best practices in supporting the emotional wellbeing of their student population.
Being awarded this digital credential is dependent on the participant fulfilling all the Jisc training course criteria. In doing so this participant has shown they are able to:
Support a distressed student
Address challenging behaviour
Develop an understanding of our emotional systems
Aquire communication skills and manage common reactions
Participants will demonstrate they have met these outcomes by;
Having taken part in all activities
Fully engaged in interaction
Contributed to discussions
Completed all assignments

7fd3153b-1897-4e4c-8c4c-ed9aa1592e14.description: This course has been designed to extend your basic knowledge of creating and formatting common data visualisations within Heidi Plus, by using a combination of pre-defined analytical components with your own written formula to enhance your data visualisations.
7fd3153b-1897-4e4c-8c4c-ed9aa1592e14.name: Heidi Plus Intermediate

badge_template_activities.title: Heidi Plus Essentials

Heidi Plus Intermediate is a fully interactive course that requires participants to engage in practical activities using Heidi Plus and HESA data. On completion of this course the participant will be able to:

Write conditional statements (calculated fields) and apply pre-defined analytics (table calculations and reference lines) to your data visualisations, in order to benchmark the performance of higher education providers
Write formula (conditional statements, create and edit dimensions and measures etc) to enhance data manipulation techniques
Apply pre-defined analytical components (table calculations and reference lines) to data visualisations
Blend written formula with pre-defined computations to benchmark the performance of Higher Education Providers
Participants will demonstrate they have met these outcomes by:
Participated in each of the interactive activities
Completed homework tasks
Attended the full training session(s)

8f2521b8-414b-49c1-8725-1502fef24707.description: Digital storytelling workshop is aimed at anyone with an interest in developing the use of stories within their personal or professional practice. It is of particular benefit to practitioners in curriculum design, public engagement with research and supporting students, particularly students from underrepresented groups.
8f2521b8-414b-49c1-8725-1502fef24707.name: Digital storytelling

badge_template_activities.title: Digital storytelling

The course consists of four participative live online sessions with tasks to be completed between each session. They will then have been awarded the Jisc training course completed digital badge and further to this fulfilled the following criteria for this Jisc training course demonstrated digital badge;
This learner has submitted all the workshop assignments to an acceptable standard. Including the following;
This learner has completed a storyboarded "previsualisation" of the story script of around 300 words.
This learner has completed a finished video digital story of around 2 mins (but no longer than 4 mins) using Adobe Spark or alternative video platform.

3cfd1585-df89-4cc8-b8d7-0043305b779c.description: Digital storytelling workshop is aimed at anyone with an interest in developing the use of stories within their personal or professional practice. It is of particular benefit to practitioners in curriculum design, public engagement with research and supporting students, particularly students from underrepresented groups.
3cfd1585-df89-4cc8-b8d7-0043305b779c.name: Digital storytelling

badge_template_activities.title: The course consists of two participative online workshops with tasks to be completed between each session:
Session 1 – Becoming a storyteller and Planning and visualising a digital story
Session 2 – Making your story digital
Course outcomes are that this participant will have:

Evaluated existing digital stories to determine effective practice; Written, planned and produced a digital story based on your own personal or professional experiences; Created a draft plan for your own digital storytelling project; Produced take away materials and skills to share with your teams; Shown evidence of your CPD through digital credentials available on completion of certain activities; Shared good practice and learnt from others from within the education community
The participant has demonstrated they have met these outcomes by:
Taking part in all activities.
Being fully engaged in interactions.
Contributed to discussions.
Completed all assignments.

c19f388f-1f89-457f-9c07-32bf3f048002.description: Modern students face a plethora of stressful and emotionally difficult situations. Their digital lifestyles mean that these situations can occur 24 hours a day, seven days a week and it is often frontline staff who are the first on the scene. The course includes scenarios that relate to difficult emotions, common mental health difficulties and addressing challenging behaviour.
c19f388f-1f89-457f-9c07-32bf3f048002.name: Managing Emotionally Challenging Situations for Frontline Staff

badge_template_activities.title: Managing Emotionally Challenging Situations for Frontline Staff

This Managing Emotionally Challenging Situations for Frontline Staff course consists of of a 2x 2 hour live online sessions. This course runs through a series of scenarios allowing delegates to practice and develop their skills in managing emotionally challenging conversations. It provides an opportunity for organisations to identify and share best practices in supporting the emotional wellbeing of their student population.

The course consists of two participative live online sessions with tasks to be completed between each session. They will then have been awarded the Jisc training course completed digital badge and further to this fulfilled the following criteria for this Jisc training course demonstrated digital badge;
This learner has  read, completed and submitted all the course assignments to an acceptable standard. Including the following;
Read the material on communication inc. de-escalation techniques in the Session 1 hand-out
Completed the reflective journal in the Session 1 hand-out
Completed the assessment on itslearning
Contributed to the forum about your organisation’s policies on itslearning

a1f32b21-8b93-49fe-981a-4eee2a3f945e.description: This is the third course in a series of four on the theme of making assistive technology decisions. The course is suitable for those seeking an introduction to strategic approaches for deploying assistive technology, there are opportunities for more experienced practitioners to reflect on or enhance their existing practice.
a1f32b21-8b93-49fe-981a-4eee2a3f945e.name: Making assistive technology decisions: strategic approaches to implementing assistive technology

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of this Jisc training course entails taking part and being fully engaged throughout the live online session. This participant has demonstrated they have met these outcomes by: • Taking part in all activities • Being fully engaged in interactions • Contributing to discussions

skills.name: Accessibility And Inclusiveness In Course Design

e4ae7884-fb62-4ced-b14c-609e75fe91f3.description: This Introduction to VR/AR in education course introduces delegates to how immersive technologies like VR and AR can be used to add value to the learner experience and best practice to deliver them effectively. It also examines how institutions can be positioned to better understand and exploit emergent technologies.
e4ae7884-fb62-4ced-b14c-609e75fe91f3.name: Introduction to VR/AR in education

badge_template_activities.title: This Introduction to VR/AR in education course consists of 1 half day workshop F2F (face to face). Being awarded this digital credential is dependent on the participant fulfilling all the Jisc training course criteria. In doing so this participant has shown they have:
Gained a basic understanding of new technologies such as VR/AR
Recognised common issues with implementing new technology
Learned good practices for delivering new technology implementation successfully
Explored recommendations on how staff can bring VR/AR into their organisation on a very tight budget
Understood which technologies could potentially disrupt education in the future and better position their organisations
Participants will demonstrate they have met these outcomes by;
Having taken part in all activities
Fully engaged in interaction
Contributed to discussions
Completed all assignments

685d9132-b727-4b84-8d9d-b1849357afa4.description: The way in which digital collections and individual items are created and maintained on the web will significantly affect the discoverability and use of your resources for teaching, learning and research. By developing workflows aimed at the promotion and discoverability of assets, collection owners can improve the visibility and persistence of their content, as well as increasing the return on investment from their creation. Our workshops help you maximise the reach of those collections online.
685d9132-b727-4b84-8d9d-b1849357afa4.name: Maximising the use of digital collections in learning and research

badge_template_activities.title: This course consists of two x2 hour live online sessions. Being awarded this digital credential is dependent on the participant fulfilling all the Jisc training course criteria. In doing so this participant has shown they are able to:
Increase visibility of their digital collections
Evaluate impact and realise the benefits of investment in their digital collections
Strategically promote their digital collections in appropriate contexts, for a range of audiences
Optimise their collection for discovery via Google and other search tools
Use web analytics to track and monitor access and usage of their digital collections
This participant has demonstrated they have met these outcomes by:
Taking part in all activities
Being fully engaged in interactions
Contributing to discussions

1c77172d-0891-4e55-ac9e-048a8051cbd9.description: This is the first course in a series of four on the theme of making assistive technology decisions. Attendees come with some understanding of the experiences of students who are disabled or have additional support requirements and the course is designed for those seeking an introduction to needs assessment in further and higher education with an interest in assistive technology and empowering disabled students.
1c77172d-0891-4e55-ac9e-048a8051cbd9.name: Making assistive technology decisions: needs assessment essentials

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of this Jisc training course entails taking part and being fully engaged throughout the live online session. This participant has demonstrated they have met these outcomes by: • Taking part in all activities • Being fully engaged in interactions • Contributing to discussions

skills.name: Accessibility And Inclusiveness In Course Design

63688afd-c72e-41ba-9b27-4ad0447162a9.description: The course provides an introduction to the privacy and legal issues that arise when designing and operating shared computers, networks and services. Systems that do not respect users’ privacy are unlikely to be trusted: to avoid this, organisations need to understand when their actions may be seen as invading privacy, reduce such actions as far as possible, and have a clear justification for those that remain.
63688afd-c72e-41ba-9b27-4ad0447162a9.name: Computers, privacy and the law

badge_template_activities.title: The course uses situations that occur frequently in universities and colleges to discuss how to determine when privacy may be affected, when this may be necessary, and how it can be minimised.  Attending the course should help you develop your own systems, processes and policies that respect privacy and provide reliable and trustworthy services.

This course consists of 3 participative live online sessions with short offline assignments to be completed between each session. This learner has attended all 3 sessions and completed each element within each individual session:
Session 1: Orientation & Understanding Privacy
Session 2: Improving Privacy
Session 3: Next steps & review
This participant has demonstrated they have met these outcomes by:
Taking part in all activities.
Being fully engaged in interactions.
Contributing to discussions.

skills.name: Achieve Compliance With The Latest Data Privacy Regulations
Apply Knowledge Of Data Security & Privacy

1e23b792-9914-4713-bfe1-739aa9f3aaf5.description: The way in which digital collections and individual items are created and maintained on the web will significantly affect the discoverability and use of your resources for teaching, learning and research. By developing workflows aimed at the promotion and discoverability of assets, collection owners can improve the visibility and persistence of their content, as well as increasing the return on investment from their creation. Our workshops help you maximise the reach of those collections online.
1e23b792-9914-4713-bfe1-739aa9f3aaf5.name: Measuring usage and impact with digital collections

badge_template_activities.title: This course consists of two x2 hour live online sessions. Being awarded this digital credential is dependent on the participant fulfilling all the Jisc training course criteria. In doing so this participant has shown they are able to:
Increase visibility of your digital collections
Evaluate impact and realise the benefits of investment in your digital collections
Use web analytics to track and monitor access and usage of your digital collections
This participant has demonstrated they have met these outcomes by:
Taking part in all activities
Being fully engaged in interactions
Contributing to discussions

3f3abac6-ce89-40c4-bade-ec285b8c380d.description: Digital leaders programme explores and challenges the role of leadership across a broad range of digital-related issues and the way they influence organisational strategy and individual practice. Aimed at current and aspiring leaders and managers from higher and further education organisations, the programme forms part of our wider approach to building digital capability in the sectors we support.
3f3abac6-ce89-40c4-bade-ec285b8c380d.name: Digital leaders programme

badge_template_activities.title: Digital leaders programme
Digital leaders programme

This is an optional advanced badge that participants can apply for upon submission of a further reflective piece of work that demonstrates and evidences the impact (or planned impact) on institutional practice or strategy based on knowledge gained from undertaking the DLP.

The earner of this badge has completed the Foundation and Intermediate Jisc Digital Leaders Programme and submitted an advanced reflective submission outlining how knowledge gained through the Digital Leaders Programme has been implemented, evidencing impact (or planned impact) on institutional change, practice or strategy.

Submissions are welcomed in flexible format including audio, video, or text format up to a maximum of 8 mins or 1200 words. Participants are encouraged to incorporate diagrams or images as appropriate.

3478b25f-5698-40df-a116-1c3b3c520392.description: This hands-on course takes participants through how eduroam operates at both a basic technical level, but also at a support level. Hands-on experience in labs is provided, showing how a RADIUS server can be configured for eduroam (both for home and for visited usage), examining the RADIUS proxy traffic and changing the contents of proxied messages. It consists of 1 day F2F (face to face)
3478b25f-5698-40df-a116-1c3b3c520392.name: Implementing eduroam at your organisation

badge_template_activities.title: This Implementing eduroam at your organisation course consists of 1 day F2F (face to face). Being awarded this digital credential is dependent on the participant fulfilling all the Jisc training course criteria. In doing so this participant has shown they are able to:

Describe EAP/RADIUS and eduroam proxying; Describe the EAP authentication cycle; Understand the additional requirements on equipment; Describe the relationship between eduroam and eduroamUK; Understand why and how to compile FreeRADIUS; Understand output from FreeRADIUS in debug mode; Understand how to configure FreeRADIUS as a visited site ORPS; Understand how to perform a packet capture of RADIUS traffic; Understand how to configure FreeRADIUS as a basic home site ORPS;

Apply knowledge of RADIUS proxying to describe the eduroam authentication infrastructure and how eduroam proxies requests; Understand how to integrate FreeRADIUS with Active Directory; Describe the eduroamUK support server; Understand how to use the eduroamUK support server; Understand how to analyse RADIUS packets; Understand the importance of monitoring and methods that can be used; Identify the issues with getting users devices online;

Understand the requirements of a successful deployment of eduroam; Understand the importance of protecting the ORPS systems deployed; Understand VSAs, why they should be filtered and how to filter them; Describe the Operator-Name and know how to add it to proxied packets; Understand the current security levels of wireless in eduroam; Describe the importance of certificates and validating your RADIUS server; Understand the eduroam monitoring system;
Identify common error messages from RADIUS servers and what they mean.
Participants will demonstrate they have met these outcomes by;
Having taken part in all activities
Fully engaged in interaction
Contributed to discussions
Completed all assignments

skills.name: And Define The Specific Wireless Standards

bb02b552-9f6c-4f49-a3d0-2879f4a07420.description: This information security policies course takes a broad view of risks to these aspects – accuracy, availability and confidentiality – of information security. We examine the origin of these risks in behaviours, processes, physical, technical and environmental factors; and consider how policies can be used to mitigate and manage the risks.
bb02b552-9f6c-4f49-a3d0-2879f4a07420.name: Information security policies

badge_template_activities.title: The course consists of two two-hour live online sessions. Being awarded this digital credential is dependent on the participant fulfilling all the Jisc training course criteria. In doing so this participant has shown they are able to:
Describe the different sources of risk to information security
Explain the different ways that risks can harm information security
Describe the impact of user perception on information security
Analyse, and give examples of, the different components of risk
Propose and assess different ways of treating risks
Use different approaches to identifying risks
Identify which risks are a priority for treatment
Understand the advantages and disadvantages of using standard security policy frameworks (e.g. ISO27001, UCISA toolkit)
Use risk assessment as a basis for organisational policies that reduce risks
Explain the need for policies to be part of an information security management system (ISMS)
Explain the plan/do/check/act model of an ISMS
Identify relevant feedback mechanisms to improve policies and the ISMS
Explain the usefulness of an information security forum
Analyse the criticality of a system and select appropriate risk mitigation
Participants will demonstrate they have met these outcomes by;
Having taken part in all activities
Fully engaged in interaction
Contributed to discussions
Completed all assignments

73719917-db54-4828-8ee1-589a14b3a676.description: This is the fourth course in a series of four on the theme of making assistive technology decisions. The course is suitable ffor those seeking an introduction to assistive technology for VI students in further and higher education, there are opportunities for more experienced practitioners to reflect on or enhance their existing practice.
73719917-db54-4828-8ee1-589a14b3a676.name: Making assistive technology decisions: assistive technology for students who have a vision impairment

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of this Jisc training course entails taking part and being fully engaged throughout the live online session. This participant has demonstrated they have met these outcomes by: • Taking part in all activities • Being fully engaged in interactions • Contributing to discussions

d3766900-96b1-4c3d-beb0-2f9fb3574eb7.description: The ability to write and repurpose content for the web is an important skill. Visitors can abandon your site at the click of a button if they are not engaged by what you have written. From September 2018, legislation now means digital inclusion is a right for users rather than a privilege. People writing content for organisational websites need to understand the impact of clear communication on accessibility.
d3766900-96b1-4c3d-beb0-2f9fb3574eb7.name: Writing for the digital world

badge_template_activities.title: Writing for the digital world

This Writing for the digital world course consists of a 2x 2 hour participative live online sessions with tasks to be completed between each session. They will then have been awarded the Jisc training course completed digital badge and further to this fulfilled the following criteria for this Jisc training course demonstrated digital badge;

This participant has created and submitted the following self-directed study activity in-between the 2 sessions to an acceptable standard:  ‘Reducing the text’ - Choosen a topic and written a first draft (between 500 and 1,000 words). Then re-written and reduced the word count by fifty percent using the techniques learned from session 1.

73d502e1-b32d-4256-a535-848f98130efd.description: Analytics Labs for DfE is a joint project between Jisc and the Department for Education (DfE) Our Analytics Labs see cross-organisational teams of business intelligence experts, and others with data analysis and visualisation experience, working together in an Agile way.
73d502e1-b32d-4256-a535-848f98130efd.name: Analytics Labs for DfE

badge_template_activities.title: The teams use cutting-edge tools to carry out data analysis and create proof-of-concept visualisations and dashboards for a variety of stakeholders to support decision-making.
This participant has attended for the entire 3 months and demonstrated the following five competencies:
Participating in Agile Development
Visualising Data
Transforming Data
Digital Collaboration
Understanding Policy and the Data Landscape

66ba6874-8f92-4342-8b4a-f376161b1754.description: Digital storytelling workshop is aimed at anyone with an interest in developing the use of stories within their personal or professional practice. It is of particular benefit to practitioners in curriculum design, public engagement with research and supporting students, particularly students from underrepresented groups.
66ba6874-8f92-4342-8b4a-f376161b1754.name: Digital storytelling

badge_template_activities.title: Digital storytelling
Digital storytelling

The course consists of four participative live online sessions with tasks to be completed between each session. They will then have been awarded the Jisc training course completed and demonstrated digital badges and further to this fulfilled the following criteria for this Jisc training course implemented digital badge;
In no less than 30 days after the course and no more than 6 months after the course:
Submitted a reflection (suggested 300-800 words) on how the course has impacted personal practice, and the impact it has had on any institutional practices if applicable.

b8f09e30-a4e1-48ef-b51f-d2af75b929b0.description: This course has been designed to extend your existing Heidi Plus knowledge to become an advanced user, by combining complex written formula and parameters, using linked data sets; to create advanced data visualisations using HESA data (Student, Staff, Finance, Estates, Student Leaver data etc).
b8f09e30-a4e1-48ef-b51f-d2af75b929b0.name: Heidi Plus Advanced

badge_template_activities.title: Heidi Plus Essentials
Heidi Plus Intermediate

Heidi Plus Advanced is a fully interactive course that requires participants to engage in practical activities using Heidi Plus and HESA data. On completion of this course the participant will be able to:
Write complex formula to create dimensions, measures and conditional clauses (with a particular focus on using LOD Expressions etc)
Create parameters to forecast and benchmark the performance of Higher Education Providers using HESA data (Student, Staff, Finance, Estates, Student leavers etc)
Create interactive business dashboard(s)
Link multiple data sources together
Participants will demonstrate they have met these outcomes by:
Participated in each of the interactive activities
Completed homework tasks
Attended the full training session(s)

bc0efa60-8478-4ad3-a991-eabec83cfade.description: Designing for digital capabilities in the curriculum is a 2 session live online workshop. It will build confidence to design and deliver a digital curriculum that will prepare students to learn successfully in digital settings, and to thrive in a digital world. It will also include a series of activities which will support participants with designing in opportunities for students to develop relevant digital capabilities into their course, module or unit of learning.
bc0efa60-8478-4ad3-a991-eabec83cfade.name: Designing for digital capabilities in the curriculum

badge_template_activities.title: This course consists of two x2 hour live online sessions. The learner has been awarded the completed digital badge for taking part in all activities, being fully engaged in interactions, contributing to discussions. And further to this fulfilled the following criteria for this Jisc training course demonstrated digital badge;
Uploaded five pieces of evidence to the Jisc training learning management system in response to each of five live activities
Uploaded one completed reflection form to the Jisc training learning management system

bff52880-62f9-4aa5-a0df-76eb6ae8967a.description: Supporting learners’ digital identity and wellbeing is a 2 hour live online workshop which equips participants with an understanding of the issues learners face when developing digital identities. The workshop helps build confidence in participants and provide them with a range of activities to use with learners so they can make informed and responsible choices when using digital technologies that help them thrive in a digital world.
bff52880-62f9-4aa5-a0df-76eb6ae8967a.name: Supporting learners’ digital identity and wellbeing

badge_template_activities.title: Supporting learners’ digital identity and wellbeing

The course consists of one participative live online session. It provides an opportunity for organisations to identify and share best practices in how to support learners' digital identity and wellbeing.

Being awarded this digital credential is dependent on the participant fulfilling all the Jisc training course criteria. They will then have been awarded the Jisc training course completed digital badge and further to this fulfilled the following criteria for this Jisc training course demonstrated digital badge which is to be completed and submitted up-to, and no more than 4 weeks after the session
Created and submitted a self-directed study activity after the session to an acceptable standard
Completed all activities in the course exercise book, including reflections on your own digital identity and wellbeing

fd33952f-2f3e-4d45-865e-878e8af35a77.description: This live online course covers the basics of Network Sniffing, from configuring networking devices to enable sniffing to occur, through to interpreting the output of the Wireshark tool. It explores alternative tools that can be used to support network-based investigations.
fd33952f-2f3e-4d45-865e-878e8af35a77.name: Using Free Network Tools

badge_template_activities.title: This course is delivered over 5 days throughout 5 live online sessions and includes short offline assignments to be completed between each session. This learner has attended all 5 sessions and completed each element within each individual session:
Session 1: Introduction to Wireshark
Session 2: Further Wireshark
Session 3: Wireshark for Security
Session 4: Tools Beyond Wireshark
Session 5: Wireshark Scenarios
This participant has demonstrated they have met these outcomes by:
Taking part in all activities
Being fully engaged in interactions
Contributing to discussions

a30e35ae-a6fb-4e44-b987-e1442b835f5b.description: The ability to write and repurpose content for the web is an important skill. Visitors can abandon your site at the click of a button if they are not engaged by what you have written. From September 2018, legislation now means digital inclusion is a right for users rather than a privilege. People writing content for organisational websites need to understand the impact of clear communication on accessibility.
a30e35ae-a6fb-4e44-b987-e1442b835f5b.name: Writing for the digital world

badge_template_activities.title: Writing for the digital world
Writing for the digital world

This Writing for the digital world course consists of a 2x 2 hour participative live online sessions with tasks to be completed between each session. They will then have been awarded the Jisc training course completed and demonstrated digital badges. Further to this fulfilled the following criteria for this Jisc training course implemented digital badge;

This participant has demonstrated how this has impacted on their personal practice and/or on institutional practices.  To be completed and submitted up-to, and no more than 2 weeks after the 2nd session. Examples of this include (but are not limited to, see below).

Links to live content published on the institution’s website evidencing the techniques practised in the online workshops – these could be short articles, blog posts, news items, instructional content for intranets, etc.
Details of internal staff development sessions carried out by the participant and cascaded to other members of the institution, demonstrating good practice when writing for the web.
Recorded meeting notes/internal policy documents inputted to (or coordinated by) the participant that evidence quality assurance processes to ensure good practice when writing for the web.

5b615bfd-9ec0-43b3-b1fb-335b6ccff03b.description: Raise awareness of accessibility practices amongst staff across your institution with our ‘best practice’ short course. The course is suitable for staff who create documents, communications, resources or learning material in their role. It gives participants opportunities to question, reflect on and develop knowledge to make existing working practice more accessible. It is aimed at anyone wishing to understand digital accessibility and how this relates to the everyday personal practice of staff.
5b615bfd-9ec0-43b3-b1fb-335b6ccff03b.name: Accessibility: Awareness raising & day to day tools

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of this Jisc training course entails taking part and being fully engaged throughout the live online session. This participant has demonstrated they have met these outcomes by: • Taking part in all activities • Being fully engaged in interactions • Contributing to discussions

941aa358-ed59-46f3-a477-f01ed60a4c6c.description: This course examines the capabilities of filtering and monitoring technologies, how they can be used in educational organisations, and the policy and legal framework that supports them. The course helps you assess your own organisation’s requirements, and how filtering and monitoring might contribute to achieving them. Finally we look at the different ways of deploying filtering and monitoring on your network, and some of the solutions available on the market.
941aa358-ed59-46f3-a477-f01ed60a4c6c.name: Filtering and monitoring: how can they help?

badge_template_activities.title: This course consists of 3 participative live online sessions with short offline assignments to be completed between each session. This learner has attended all 3 sessions and completed each element within each individual session:
Session 1: Orientation & What is filtering and monitoring
Session 2: Policies, procedures and regulations
Session 3: Next steps & review
This participant has demonstrated they have met these outcomes by:
Taking part in all activities.
Being fully engaged in interactions.
Contributing to discussions.

d4030f73-c396-47e4-919a-817e068daa99.description: Our Heidi Plus 2020.4 Advanced training course has been designed to provide you with the requisite knowledge and skills to create advanced charts, dashboards, and stories using HESA data sets. During this 4-day, online course you will learn how to manipulate and analyse HESA data sets using a combination of pre-defined analytical components and written formula.
d4030f73-c396-47e4-919a-817e068daa99.name: Heidi Plus 2020.4 Advanced

badge_template_activities.title: Heidi Plus Advanced is a fully interactive course that requires participants to engage in practical activities using Heidi Plus and HESA data. On completion of this course the participant will be able to:
Use and apply pre-defined analytical components to data visualisations (quick table calculations)
Create derived fields using written formula (benchmarking groups, competitor groups, LOD expressions etc)
Create and apply dynamic parameters to forecast and benchmark performance
Create interactive business dashboards and stories
Blend primary and secondary data sources together
Participants will demonstrate they have met these outcomes by:
Participated in each of the interactive activities
Completed all homework tasks
Attended the full training session(s)

skills.name: Data Protection Training For Gold Users And Lead Contacts

6a21d4e7-9937-4515-8cac-66f7209e7be4.description: Led by Rhys Smith, our chief technical architect, trust and identity, the course starts off by providing a number of discussions and hands-on labs for delegates to work through individually and in a small group, centred around the installation and configuration of a Shibboleth 3 identity provider; this is then tested against a reference Shibboleth service provider.
6a21d4e7-9937-4515-8cac-66f7209e7be4.name: Implementing Shibboleth at your organisation

badge_template_activities.title: This Implementing Shibboleth at your organisation course consists of two, one-day workshops F2F (face to face).  Both workshops have a particular emphasis on hands-on activities which take up most of both days. These activities will be performed on either a Linux (CentOS 6) or Windows (Windows Server 2008 R2) Virtual Machine (VM), running on VMWare Server on laptops provided as part of the course.
Being awarded this digital credential is dependent on the participant fulfilling all the Jisc training course criteria as outlined below:
By the end of day one (identity provider) this participant is able to:
Understand Shibboleth Identity provider prerequisites
Identity provider installation
Identity provider configuration & Advanced identity provider topics
By the end of day two (service provider) this participant is able to:
Service provider prerequisites
Service provider installation
Service provider configuration
Integrate Shibboleth with web applications
Understand advanced service provider topics
Participants will demonstrate they have met these outcomes by;
Having taken part in all activities
Fully engaged in interaction
Contributed to discussions
Completed all assignments
